intro: Hastingsia atropurpurea, commonly known as the purple globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, globular clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant has hairy, ribbed stems and heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Hastingsia atropurpurea is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to withstand drought conditions.
